alert.note: Alert for North Cass (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 10:03PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN CASS COUNTY THROUGH 1030 PM CDT... At 1003 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Leech Lake, or 13 miles north of Walker, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Federal Dam and Leech Lake around 1020 PM CDT. Boy River around 1025 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Six Mile Lake, Boy Lake, Tobique, Portage Lake, Wilkinson, Mud Lake, Goose Lake and Cass Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
